org.gearvrf

Class SensorEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gearvrf.SensorEvent

  • public class SensorEvent
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides all the information corresponding to events generated by a GVRBaseSensor. When GVRf detects cases where a given GVRBaseSensor is activated by user interaction the ISensorEvents is triggered and a SensorEvent is delivered to the application. Make sure that the app consumes the SensorEvent data within the callback as these objects are recycled.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SensorEvent.EventGroup
      SensorEvents can be grouped with other SensorEvents according to the depth of the GVRSceneObject that the event occurred on.

      Deprecated. 
      Returns a new float array every call which may lead to frequent GC cycles. Use the more efficient call to {getHitX()}, {getHitY()} and {getHitZ()}.

      Get the 'Y' component of the hit point.

    • Method Detail

      • getObject

        public GVRSceneObject getObject()
        Use this call to retrieve the affected object.
        Returns:
        The affected GVRSceneObject that caused this SensorEvent to be triggered.

      • isOver

        public boolean isOver()
        Use this flag to detect if the input "is over" the GVRSceneObject .
        Returns:
        true if the input is over the corresponding GVRSceneObject. The ISensorEvents delivers multiple sensor events when this state is true and only one event when this state is false.

      • getHitX

        public float getHitX()
        Get the X component of the hit point. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the ISensorEvents.onSensorEvent(SensorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'X' component of the hit point.

      • getHitY

        public float getHitY()
        Get the 'Y' component of the hit point. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the ISensorEvents.onSensorEvent(SensorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Y' component of the hit point.

      • getHitZ

        public float getHitZ()
        Get the 'Z' component of the hit point. The values returned by this call persist only for the duration of the ISensorEvents.onSensorEvent(SensorEvent) call. Make sure to make a copy of this value if you wish to use it past its lifetime.
        Returns:
        'Z' component of the hit point.

      • getHitPoint

        public float[] getHitPoint()
        Deprecated. Returns a new float array every call which may lead to frequent GC cycles. Use the more efficient call to {getHitX()}, {getHitY()} and {getHitZ()}.
        Returns the hit point of the input and the affected GVRSceneObject
        Returns:
        The coordinates where the input intersects with the GVRSceneObject.

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns the active status of the SensorEvent.
        Returns:
        true when the provided input has an active state and false otherwise. This usually denotes a button press on a given input event. The actual interaction that causes the active state is defined by the input provided to the GVRInputManagerImpl.

      • getCursorController

        public GVRCursorController getCursorController()
        Returns the GVRCursorController that generated this event.
        Returns:
        the GVRCursorController object.

      • getEventGroup

        public SensorEvent.EventGroup getEventGroup()
        Gets the SensorEvent.EventGroup associated with the SensorEvent. See SensorEvent.EventGroup.
        Returns:
        The SensorEvent.EventGroup of the SensorEvent
